result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Aaron B Marcoux appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls all cases and appearances. Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. Agreement reached-Set for plea hearing. Bond to continue.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 4, 2023 at 10:00 am.

Status from Atty Thomas-Schmidt. No objections from the State. Bond to continue.

Berschneider.  Court calls cases and appearances. Court questions the defendant re: his right to appear in person.  Court finds the defendant waives his right to appear in person. Preliminary hearing in 22CF56-Status in all CM cases. Track w/ CF-Bond to continue.
Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:50 am.

Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.

1:00 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Christian Ness in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Gabe Pollak and Intern Connor Hanson appeared by video for Kyle E. Berschneider. Court calls case and appearances. Court reviews file. Court questions the non-appearance by defendant. Mr. Hanson speaks to the court. Court speaks to the parties. Court questions the defendant. State makes bond argument-requesting a $2500 cash bond. Mr. Hanson makes bond argument to the court-requesting a signature bond. Court sets bond.
Status conference scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:55 pm.

10:29 AM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider in court with attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt.  Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider in custody.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and appearances. Waived reading. Not guilty plea is entered.  Status conference scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.

01:01 PM Defendant Kyle E. Berschneider in court, in custody.  Sheila M. Yohnk appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Christian Ness appears for the Public Defenders Office.  Court calls cases and appearances. Atty Ness making a special appearance. Defendant makes statement to the court re: non-appearance. Court questions def. does not have an address to report. State requests cash bond, makes argument. Defendant does not have ability to post any cash. Argument from Atty Ness. Court speaks to the parties and sets cash bond to cover all cases.  Defendant speaks to the court. State speaks to the court re: bond conditions. Atty Ness makes statement. Court speaks to the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
